articles.title: Elderly face health risks amid climate hazards
articles.author: Edith Mutethya
articles.summary: There will be 16 percent more people over 65 by 2050, according to Frontiers 2025 report by UNEP. Annual heat-related deaths among older persons have risen by 85 percent since the 1990s. UNEP recommends better urban planning, community-based disaster risk management, and improved access to climate information for older populations.

articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: The South Island giant moa is the tallest bird to have ever walked the face of Earth, standing more than three metres (12ft) high. It is based in South Island, New Zealand, and is three times the size of a kangaroo.

articles.title: Why does the wind blow side to side and not up and down? The kids' quiz
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: Chloe, 10½, asks why the wind blows side to side and not up and down. Chloe's answers are: Clouds tell the wind which way to go, Earth spins, warm and cool air move sideways, birds flap their wings sideways and gravity pulls all wind flat.
